page.title: 12HEALTH STRACATHRO
page.content: {Stracathro Hospital}was built in{1939 on ground owned by the Campbell family. As an{emergency hospital}it was capable of holding 1000 patients and many{prisoners of war}were treated here. The first patient was a Polish soldier who was in for 56 days in 1940 and who emerged fighting fit! {The Mansion House is now a scheduled {building of architectural value.}The present{Medical Library in the Mansion {contains one of the very few barrel {ceilings to be seen in Britain. The present{bed complement is 430}with facilities in{almost all specialities. The Hospital consists of{four main {Ward Blocks,}with a central Service block housing Kitchen, Diningrooms, Laboratory, Pharmacy and Offices. The hospital has{its own sewage plant and incinerator, employing only 2 men.
